algorithms.name: determine pairs of gap decoration endpoints
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="determine-pairs-of-gap-decoration-endpoints" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">determine pairs of gap decoration endpoints</dfn> within a given <var>gap</var>:

steps.html: Let pairs be an empty list. Let endpoints be the list of gap intersection points that fall along the centerline of gap, ordered from start to end along gap’s axis. Let break be the used value of either column-rule-break or row-rule-break, whichever applies to gap.
If <var>endpoints</var> contains fewer than 2 items, return <var>pairs</var>.
If break is other than none, and the first two items in endpoints are discontiguous, remove the first item from endpoints, then go back to step 2.

Remove the first item from <var>endpoints</var>.
				Let <var>start</var> be equal to that item.

Remove the first item from <var>endpoints</var>.
				Let <var>end</var> be equal to that item.

If <var>endpoints</var> is non-empty, and any of the following conditions are true... 
      
       ...then go back to step 5.
ignored: break is none. break is spanning-item, and start is not discontiguous with the first item in endpoints. break is intersection, and start is not discontiguous with the first item in endpoints, and the intersection is flanked by spanning items on opposing sides.

steps.html: Compute the offset for start within gap. Offset start by the result, in the forward direction along gap’s axis.
Compute the offset for end within gap. Offset end by the result, in the reverse direction along gap’s axis.
Add to <var>pairs</var> a tuple consisting of <var>start</var> and <var>end</var>.
Go back to step 2.

algorithms.name: compute the offset
algorithms.html: To compute the offset for a given gap intersection point point within a given gap:

steps.html: Let width be the crossing gap width for point.
Let outset be the computed value of either column-rule-outset or row-rule-outset, whichever applies to gap. Resolve any percentages in outset against width.

Let <var>result</var> be <var>width</var> multiplied by 50%.
				Subtract <var>outset</var> from <var>result</var>.
Return <var>result</var>.

algorithms.name: assign gap decoration values
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="assign-gap-decoration-values" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">assign gap decoration values</dfn> to a list of <var>gaps</var> using a list of <var>values</var>:

steps.html: Replace any integer repeaters in values with their expanded-out equivalents.
If the list contains no auto repeater, then:

Beginning from the first item in <var>values</var> and the first item in <var>gaps</var>,
						assign each value to the corresponding gap.
						If there are fewer values than gaps,
						repeat beginning from the first item in <var>values</var>,
						as many times as needed.
End this algorithm.
values contains an auto repeater. Let leading count be the number of items in values before the auto repeater. Let trailing count be the number of items in values after the auto repeater.
Partition <var>gaps</var> as follows:
Let <var>leading gaps</var> contain the first <var>leading count</var> items in <var>gaps</var>.

Let <var>trailing gaps</var> contain the last <var>trailing count</var> items in <var>gaps</var>,
						excluding any items in <var>leading gaps</var>.
Let <var>auto gaps</var> contain any items in <var>gaps</var> that are not in either <var>leading gaps</var> or <var>trailing gaps</var>.
If leading gaps is non-empty, assign gap decoration values to leading gaps using the first leading count items in values.
If trailing gaps is non-empty, assign gap decoration values in reverse to trailing gaps using the last trailing count items in values.
If auto gaps is non-empty, assign gap decoration values to auto gaps using the list of values in the second argument of the auto repeater.
